10

Scenes from Fenway's 100th

Former Red Sox players Kevin Millar and Pedro Martinez raised a toast with all the fans to celebrate 100 years of Fenway Park. John Tlumacki/Globe Staff
Former Red Sox players Kevin Millar and Pedro Martinez raised a toast with all the fans to celebrate 100 years of Fenway Park. John Tlumacki/Globe Staff
Today is Fenway Park's 100th birthday. The Red Sox are marking the occasion with an on-field ceremony ahead of their 3:05 p.m. game with the Yankees. Elsa/Getty Images
Russ Raiche, a Red Sox employee, handed out souvenir tickets inside the gates of Yawkey Way. Stan Grossfeld/Globe Staff
The Green Monster scoreboard at Fenway Park was seen before the stadium's 100th anniversary celebration. AP Photo/Michael Dwyer
Workers placed cans of grape juice under each seat before today's game. Fans will toast the park in attempt to break a world record later today. Elsa/Getty Images
David Ortiz gave a hug to manager Bobby Valentine before stepping into the cage to take batting practice. John Tlumacki/Globe Staff

Military now says 11 service members were involved in Colombia scandal

Officials said 11 service members are being investigated for alleged misconduct in Colombia, up from the 10 personnel last believed to be involved. (AP, 3:10 p.m.)
  • More Complete coverage of the Secret Service scandal

Zimmerman apologizes; bail set at $150K

George Zimmerman apologized for the shooting death of Trayvon Martin during his bond hearing today, where a judge set his bail at $150,000. (AP, 2:42 p.m.)
  • Discuss Should Zimmerman be allowed out on bail?
  • Pictures Zimmerman in court | US rallies for Martin

Romney raises $12.6 million in March

Mitt Romney’s campaign raised nearly $12.6 million in March, the largest monthly haul of his campaign but still far behind President Obama. (Globe, 11:54 a.m.)
  • Obama’s supporters expand efforts in swing states
  • Candidate profile: Mitt Romney  |  More Campaign 2012

Scott Brown says he may release taxes

In a radio interview, Senator Scott Brown said he would be "happy to" release his tax returns. (Globe, 11:44 a.m.)

Business

New Zealand woman's Coca-Cola drinking habit cited in her death

Experts say a New Zealand woman's 2-gallon-a-day Coca-Cola habit probably contributed to her death. The soft-drink giant responded that even water can be deadly in excess.
